findYourQuickstart.subtext: Monitor everything in your stack with 700+ integrations.

dataDictionary.title: New Relic data dictionary
dataDictionary.intro: This data dictionary defines some of our default-reported data stored in NRDB and queryable via NRQL. This includes events like Transaction, MobileRequest, and BrowserInteraction, and our Metric, Log, and Span data types. These definitions are also available from our query builder UI by mousing over applicable data type and attribute names.
introNot: Data from our infrastructure integrations (for that, see docs for a specific integration)
Detailed integration-specific attributes for Metric data
dataDictionary.callout: This dictionary does not contain data reported by Infrastructure integrations. To learn about that data, see the <2>integration documentation</2>.

home.getStarted: Get started in four easy steps

t1.title: Monitor all your apps and services

onBoarding.text: Sign up for a New Relic account to unlock powerful monitoring and observability tools.
onBoarding.title: Create an account

onBoarding.text: Begin your New Relic journey by delving into the documentation, where you'll discover a overview of its features and functionalities.
onBoarding.title: Read into to New Relic docs

onBoarding.text: Installing New Relic empowers you to quickly integrate its powerful monitoring solutions into your digital infrastructure.
onBoarding.title: Install New Relic

onBoarding.text: Explore the tutorial documentation for New Relic to quickly grasp its features and leverage its capabilities effectively.
onBoarding.title: Check out the tutorial docs

t1.title: Get started with New Relic
t1.body: Want an overview of everything in New Relic? This is a good place to start.

t2.title: Tutorials and walkthroughs
t2.body: Use our hand-crafted tutorials to step through solutions to common problems.

t3.title: Guides and best practices
t3.body: Learn more about our platform UI and mobile apps.

t1.title: AI monitoring
t1.body: Monitor your AI stack for latency, response times, compliance, and cost efficiency.

t2.title: Application performance monitoring (APM)
t2.body: Monitor application performance across your stack. We've got agents for Go, Java, .NET,  Node.js, PHP, Python, and Ruby.

t3.title: Browser monitoring
t3.body: Gain insight into how your website is performing and how your users are using your site.

t4.title: Infrastructure monitoring
t4.body: Get visibility into hosts, containers, providers, network, and  infrastructure.

t5.title: Kubernetes monitoring
t5.body: Observe the complete health and performance of your clusters and workloads.

t6.title: Log management
t6.body: Organize all your logs in one place, with support for common log forwarding tools. Includes privacy, parsing, and logs archives for long-term storage.

t7.title: Mobile monitoring
t7.body: Get performance insights for your mobile apps, from frontend experience to backend execution metrics.

t8.title: Model performance monitoring (MLOps)
t8.body: Analyze the performance and effectiveness of machine learning models.

t9.title: Network monitoring
t9.body: Map your network so you can analyze, optimize, and troubleshoot the performance of your routers, switches, and other networking devices.

t10.title: Serverless function monitoring
t10.body: Monitor your serverless AWS Lambda functions using both CloudWatch data and code-level instrumentation.

t11.title: Synthetic monitoring
t11.body: Simulate end-user activity and API calls from locations around the world, so you can find problems before your users do.

t1.title: Alerts and applied intelligence
t1.body: Alert on incidents and anomalies to fix issues before they impact your customers or your business.

t2.title: Change tracking
t2.body: Track changes in your system, like deployments, to see how they affect performance.

t3.title: Charts, dashboards, and querying
t3.body: Use charts and dashboards to visualize your data. Start with our pre-built dashboards or use our powerful query tools to build your own.

t4.title: Distributed tracing
t4.body: See how data flows across your system and pinpoint where things are getting slowed down. Find, fix, and optimize system and application performance.

t5.title: NRQL
t5.body: Dig deep into your data with our New Relic Query Language (NRQL) and get precise answers and data-driven insights.

t6.title: Service level management
t6.body: Set and measure SLIs and SLOs to see how your teams and key business metrics are performing.

t1.title: CodeStream
t1.body: Bring performance monitoring into your IDE to improve your software before you commit it to production.

t2.title: Errors inbox
t2.body: Find, share, and fix software development errors in one place.

t3.title: Interactive Application Security Testing (IAST)
t3.body: Find, verify, and fix high-risk vulnerabilities throughout your software development lifecycle. Fully integrated with vulnerability management.

t4.title: Other integrations
t4.body: Integrate technologies you rely on, like:  OpenTelemetry, Grafana, CloudFoundry, and other popular integrations.

t5.title: Vulnerability management
t5.body: Audit your applications, entities, and software libraries for security vulnerabilities and take action to remediate and reduce risk.

t6.title: Website performance monitoring
t6.body: Keep your websites fast and error-free, improve your customer experience, and your conversion rates.

t1.title: Release notes
t1.body: Stay current with all of our latest releases. Includes RSS feeds.

t2.title: Whatâ€™s new?
t2.body: Stay up to date about our new features, updates, and changes in our platform.

t1.title: Account & user management
t1.body: Go here for all your account, user management, pricing, and billing needs.

t2.title: Data and APIs
t2.body: Learn more about NRDB, our New Relic database, as well as details about metric and event data types, how we manage data, and how to use our APIs.

t3.title: Data dictionary
t3.body: Look up definitions for our attributes in a variety of data sources and data types.

t4.title: Security and privacy
t4.body: Learn how New Relic handles data security and privacy, and about our compliance certification.

t5.title: Licenses
t5.body: A reference library of our licenses and other legal documentation.

navFooter.default: Go to the New Relic platform

machineTranslation.calloutHeading: This machine translation is provided for your convenience.
machineTranslation.calloutBody: In the event of any inconsistency between the English version and the translated version, the <2>English version</2> shall prevail. Please visit <5>this page</5> for more information.

installFeedback.question: Did this doc help with your installation?
installFeedback.prompt: Tell us how can we do this better.
installFeedback.emailDisclaimer: We'll only use this email for follow-up questions about your feedback.

quickstartChooser.blurbLineOne: Choose your app's language below to install an APM agent.
quickstartChooser.blurbLineTwo: It takes just a few minutes!
quickstartChooser.heading: Ready to try APM?

surveyModal.npsIntro: How likely are you to recommend our docs to a friend or colleague?

suprQ.intro: Please rate how much you agree or disagree with the following statements:
suprQ.q1: The information on the docs site is credible.
suprQ.q2: The information in the docs is trustworthy.
suprQ.q3: The docs site is easy to use.
suprQ.q4: The docs site has a clean and simple presentation.
suprQ.q5: I will likely visit the docs site in the future.
suprQ.q6: It's easy to navigate within the docs.
suprQ.q7: I found the docs site to be attractive.
suprQ.q8: New Relic's docs read as if a friend is explaining things to me.

surveyModal.freeTextQuestion: Is there anything that you would change about New Relic docs? If so, please tell us what and why.
